It exists on MCPEDL as a resource pack, but there is one issue: If Immediate Respawn is enabled, you can respawn.

  • You may not be able to create a world with this resource pack on consoles, because of lacking options to obtain the resource pack on consoles. However, you can join another‚Äôs world with the hardcore pack, but you may need a Microsoft Account. (required to play cross platform). You also need the console‚Äôs online subscription service.
Please vote my idea üôè

Translation to English:
Komodo lizard

The Komodo lizard is a neutral animal that spawns in the jungle.

You can tame it with beef, and the player directs you to attack the mob.

The mob attacked by the Komodo lizard is killed by bacteria and poison.

You can make armour with armadillo scales.
I think this is a good idea, but it should be balanced. Like get a diamond chestplate with a random enchantment for giving said villager a trial key.
How to craft it? What does it do?
I agree, it didn‚Äôt need changing.

waxing gives the player a choice on the piston. the old piston sound works well to where you know its firing in standard contraptions. waxting it to make it silent be the best option. cause if someone makes something that needs to be silent but its in a setting. it wont work how they would want it to. since multiplayer wouldnt all be the same settings.

I love the new piston sound. They sound like a well-maintained machine. I've avoided using them due to their obnoxious omnipresence. I understand them being loud when they were first developed - a novelty at the time. Now with machines requiring dozens of them, I'm glad they've been 'oiled'.

Maybe you could waterlog pistons to make them silent sorta like how skulk sensors work. This could work well because it the new sound sounds a bit like a component underwater. To avoid water and redstone incompatibility, they could make the water logged pistons self-contained so they wouldn't spill out and destroying redstone.
maybe when a piston has not been used in a long time it makes a screeching noise
why not add oil so iron golems move faster and pistons are quieter
I really hope mojang sees this

I'm not happy with that update, I'm turning down the "Shadow And Frost" update because why? all they wanted for 1.22 is the End Update because it's out a decade ago, and it's outdated already. üò° Please stop it. I'm very tired of waiting long. üò≠üíî

Mind reformatting this so the argument keeps some sense in it? Otherwise it just sounds like a rage fueled rant that A:won't be taken seriously, and B:Reduces the chances of your argument being heard.
(A simple way to do this would be removing the extra text after "Why oh why would you revert it?")
AMAZING IDEA!!!! Trial chambers should have both combat rooms and puzzle rooms!!!
Es algo muy interesante y que puede ayudar a la gente con este nuevo bloque

I would like to add an idea especially as the Crafter doesn't look particularly old/ancient much like the rest of the Trial Chambers, but what if the Crafter in this room would be hidden behind walls and instead you put items into decorative pots which can filter out into a Crafter. This way the chambers can still have the old aesthetic while hiding the interesting redstone elements - although as stated previously, the Ancient Cities contain redstone contraptions so having obvious redstone components wouldn't feel too out-of-place.
i agree i want to see more puzzles NYEH HEH HEH
Sounds harder since that would require a lot more netherite ingots/resources.
I think looting a bastion would be easier than mining for a billion ancient debris, depending on your skill level. I think looting a bastion would be fun and exciting

I like this as an alternative to using the templates. The upgrade template is a neat concept, and I like that it adds another level of difficulty to upgrading to netherite gear, but it has always bothered me that you can‚Äôt craft netherite stuff the same way as anything else.
This would give you an expensive option if you don‚Äôt have templates to use.

This would be awesome and I don't have to get slain by a piglin brute
In a baston
love the idea but we should be able to use smithing table and the crafting table
I want this as well. Even if it is harder to get the resources, I would rather mine for more than find a structure and find enough upgrade templates.
Maybe they can become a neutral ghast that would be your friend, but would no longer attack unprovoked.
Would love to see that mechanic! Even if it doesnt turn instantly into a happy ghast. Maybe it takes some time for it to be happy again
I like the thought of the neutral ghast going ham on anything that try harms ghastling.
Yes, it's more logical for the lore, because Ghasts are sad because they are stuck in the Nether
It should also include a new mob, the piglin miner.
Honestly that's not a bad idea

items, blocks, and mob drops: 

copper gauntlets: can be equipped to chestplate slot. will remove a little defense from your armor, but depending on their description, they can either improve attack speed, or damage. dropped from copper clad knight.

copper clad shield: can be used to shield charge. shield charge attack has long cooldown. otherwise a normal shield. dropped by copper clad knight.

hoarder's blade: does diamond sword damage. has iron sword durability. larger sweep attack range. dropped by hoarder skeleton.

hoarder's ribcage: can be equipped to chestplate slot: blocks all points of damage from any attack. less durability than gold armor. dropped by hoarder

adventurer's spear: extended reach. stabs right in front of you. has piercing like a crossbow bolt from a piercing crossbow. can be thrown like trident. fund in trial supply chests.

trial key: can be used to unlock oxidized copper doors.

breeze orb: can be crafted into breeze powder to be used in fletching tables to enhance arrow speed and damage. obtained by slaying breeze

gust in a bottle: obtained by bottling a breeze bullet increases jump height.

copper signaler: can be crafted with copper ingots and redstone dust. acts exactly like redstone dust, but can signal vertically and wont connect to any other circuit unless toggled.

copper sensor: crafted with copper signaler and nether quartz shard. can be put on redstone components like pistons and dispensers to tunnel a redstone signal through one side and out the other.

It's good idea but how about this they make copper skeleton  knight boss swordmen that can summon upto 10 small hostile copper golem. 

Drops copper shield , item to create mini golem, and book enchantment that does electricity damage that groups of up to 3 enemies or so.

Cause there's is really no incentive in going into the trails chamber. The loots is total meh. Even deep dark has better loot.

I could say do that, but my suggestion still stands. I just think copper golem fit better within the passive mob category. Secondly this could be a way to add a shield charge attack mechanic (which I've wanted in game since they were added), and a new skeleton mob that is way or dangerous an rewarding to kill. The hoarder and copper clad knight ideas still stand. It my ideas are balanced and don't make raiding trial chamvers too complicated. I'm glad to see that my post is getting a lot of attention! Also as a disclaimer, I set thus post up carefully so that there are more important and interesting things, as well as less important and interesting things to add so that mojang can pick and choose what they add if this post makes it in.
Nice idea, i really like it.
I think it's not likely. It would ruin some elevators and so on. But I'd love it as a creative only item! That would bring adventure maps to a whole new level!

Bogged and Stray should convert to skeletons if it is submerged for 30 seconds in lava, however the respective mobs need fire resistance.
Skeletons should also be converted into the bogged variant if they are standing on mud for a long time.
Skeletons should only be converted to Bogged once you use mushrooms and a moss carpet on them, then submerged.
Normal skeletons could become Bogged Skeleton when the Oozing effect affects them, a period of time we would have to eliminate them before they transform
